block.p: Claire Swan Gilman, a daughter of Lynn Nesbit of New York and Richard Gilman of Kusatsu, Japan, was married in New York yesterday to Alexander Kent Anton Greenawalt, a son of Kent Greenawalt of Princeton, N.J., and the late Sanja Milic Greenawalt. The Rev. Julia O. Hollister, a Congregational minister, is to officiate with the Rev. Mark Abernethy, a United Church of Christ minister, at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University.

Ms. Gilman, 28, who will keep her name, graduated magna cum laude from Carleton College in Northfield, Minn. She received a master's degree in art history from Columbia, where she is now a doctoral candidate in that subject.

Claire Swan Gilman, a daughter of Lynn Nesbit of New York and Richard Gilman of Kusatsu, Japan, was married in New York yesterday to Alexander Kent Anton Greenawalt, a son of Kent Greenawalt of Princeton, N.J., and the late Sanja Milic Greenawalt. The Rev. Julia O. Hollister, a Congregational minister, is to officiate with the Rev. Mark Abernethy, a United Church of Christ minister, at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University.

Ms. Gilman, 28, who will keep her name, graduated magna cum laude from Carleton College in Northfield, Minn. She received a master's degree in art history from Columbia, where she is now a doctoral candidate in that subject.

Her mother, the literary agent, is a partner in Janklow & Nesbit Associates in New York. The bride's father, the drama critic, retired as a professor of dramaturgy of the Yale Drama School. He is the author of ''Chekhov's Plays: An Opening Into Eternity'' (Yale University Press, 1996). The bride's stepmother, Yasuko Shiojiri, is a professor of English at Doshisha University in Kyoto, Japan.

Mr. Greenawalt, 28, who is known as Sasha, received a law degree last week from Columbia. In August, he is to become a clerk to Judge Stephen F. Williams of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. The bridegroom graduated from Princeton University, received a master's degree in history from Yale and was a Fulbright Scholar in 1995 and 1996, studying Balkan history at Zagreb University in Croatia.

His father teaches legal philosophy and constitutional law at the Columbia University School of Law, where he is a University Professor. The bridegroom's stepmother, Elaine Pagels, is the Harrington Speare Professor of Religion at Princeton.

WEDDINGS Correction: May 28, 2000, Sunday A report last Sunday about the marriage of Claire Swan Gilman and Alexander Kent Anton Greenawalt referred incorrectly at one point to the timing of the ceremony. As noted in the first sentence, it took place the previous day, not on Sunday.

A report last Sunday about the marriage of Claire Swan Gilman and Alexander Kent Anton Greenawalt referred incorrectly at one point to the timing of the ceremony. As noted in the first sentence, it took place the previous day, not on Sunday.
